titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Henry Pointer, Indictment
CWG6541

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Henderson Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
vs
Henry Pointer

The Grand Jury of Henderson County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Henry Pointer of the offense of unlawfully migrating to this State, committed as follows: the said Henry Pointer on the day of 1859 in the County aforesaid, and since the eleventh day of June 1850 he then and there being a free negro, did migrate to this State with the intention of remaining therein against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.
S. B. Vance atty for the Comth pro tem.

Witnesses: John T. Hopkins
F J. Hopkins.
Wm Rankin
Paschal Rouse
James Rouse
I certify that the above is a true and correct copy of the indictment filed in my office. May 24th 1865
attest: Adam Rankin Clerk H. C. C.
At the June Term 1862 of said Court, a Jury was empanneled in the above case, heard the evidence &, but were unable to agree & were discharged, as appears of record
attest: Adam rankin C H C C

Commonth of Kentucky
vs } Copy Indictment
Henry Pointer
